tickerNews.title: ADRO: Analysis of Spin-off AADI Scenario
tickerNews.content: Ahead of the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) of Adaro Energy Indonesia (ticker ADRO) scheduled for 18 November 2024 and the public offering by shareholders (PUPS) of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (ticker AADI) in December 2024, we attempt to analyze the optimal option for ADRO investors regarding the corporate spin-off of AADI. There are two options for ADRO investors: 1) Participate in the AADI PUPS, which we further split into three scenarios: • Base-case scenario: implies a price-to-earnings (PE) multiple of 5x for AADI and 6.6x PE for ADRO. • Bull-case scenario: implies 5x PE for AADI and 8.9x PE for ADRO. • Bear-case scenario: implies 5x PE for AADI and 3.8x PE for ADRO. 2) Do not participate in the AADI PUPS. Option 1 – Participation in the AADI PUPS: Based on our calculations, ADRO investors who use their dividend to participate in the AADI PUPS are likely to be more advantaged because: • ADRO share price is expected to fall after the AADI spin-off and dividend distribution as net profit potential declines after the spin-off. If ADRO share price does not decline after the spin-off, ADRO could trade at a valuation of 13.3x PE. • AADI share price could be re-rated to a level of 5x PE, which we consider a more reasonable and conservative level. This 5x PE level is still below the five-year historical mean for ADRO of 6.9x PE, as well as below valuations of other coal issuers such as PTBA (7.7x PE FY24F annualized) and ITMG (6.87x PE FY24F annualized). In the long term, ADRO valuation will be influenced by market sentiment and net profit from the development of an aluminium smelter project and a hydro-electric power plant (PLTA), which are expected to become operational in 2025 and 2030 respectively.

tickerNews.title: AADI: Spin-off Participation Options
tickerNews.content: Option 2 – Not participating in the AADI IPO: We see that investors who only take the dividend and do not participate in the AADI PUPS may obtain a lower return or even risk a loss compared with investors who participate in the PUPS. This is because investors who do not participate in the AADI PUPS will face a potential decline in ADRO share price without gaining the upside from a rise in AADI share price. The redemption rights for the AADI PUPS cannot be sold. Investors taking this option may lose the thermal coal business of ADRO at a valuation of 2.7x PE 1H24 annualized, lower than the five-year historical mean for ADRO and its peers. Assumptions used: • ADRO purchase price uses the Tuesday (12/11) closing price of IDR 3,820 per share. • ADRO dividend paid at the maximum level of IDR 1,352 per share. • Dividend payment is executed simultaneously with the PUPS. • AADI PUPS price equals the upper limit of the IPO price range at IDR 5,900 per share, which is also the maximum of the PUPS price range. • Allocation ratio is 100:23 (for every 100 ADRO shares, the holder receives the right to order 23 AADI shares in the PUPS). • Exchange rate IDR to USD is 15,811.

tickerNews.title: ITMG 9M24: Net Profit Down 32.7% YoY, Beats Expectations
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah (ticker ITMG) recorded a net profit of USD 144 million (+113.3% quarter-on-quarter, +45.6% year-on-year) in 3Q24, resulting in a net profit for the nine months ended 2024 of USD 273 million (down 32.7% YoY). The 9M24 net profit exceeded expectations, reaching 76%/83% of the FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. Operationally, revenue grew 8.5% QoQ while cost of goods sold fell 0.3% QoQ, lifting gross margin to 33.6% (vs. 27.8% in 2Q24). Operating expenses increased only 6.6% QoQ, lower than gross profit growth, driving operating profit growth of 43.1% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: INCO Announces 4-fold Nickel Production Increase Target
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia (ticker INCO) announced a target to increase nickel production fourfold over the next decade to meet global demand for critical minerals used in electric energy structures and clean-technology applications. To achieve this, INCO and its partners are committing an investment of USD 9 billion.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Code Change to GOTOM for Multiple-Voting-Rights Shares
tickerNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced a change of the ticker code for multiple-voting-rights shares of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (ticker GOTO) to GOTOM. The code change is pursuant to BEI Board of Directors Decree No. Kep-00172/BEI/10-2024 dated 29 October 2024 concerning the implementation of multiple-voting-rights share registration and trading. The ordinary shares of GOTO remain listed under the code GOTO.

tickerNews.title: SPTO Announces Interim Dividend 2024
tickerNews.content: Surya Pertiwi (ticker SPTO) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to IDR 94.5 billion, or IDR 35 per share. The cum-date on the regular market is 21 November 2024, with payment scheduled for 10 December 2024. Based on SPTO's closing price on Wednesday (13/11) of IDR 665 per share, the implied dividend yield is 5.3%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO Announces Interim Dividend 2024
tickerNews.content: Surya Toto Indonesia (ticker TOTO) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately IDR 123.8 billion, or IDR 12 per share. The cum-date on the regular market is 21 November 2024, with payment scheduled for 12 December 2024. Based on TOTO's closing price on Wednesday (13/11) of IDR 238 per share, the implied dividend yield is 5.0%.

tickerNews.title: SGER Signs Coal Purchase Agreement for 2 Million Tons
tickerNews.content: Sumber Global Energy (ticker SGER) signed a coal purchase agreement for 2 million tons with PT Merge Mining Industri. The transaction is expected to generate revenue of IDR 3 trillion.

tickerNews.title: INKP Plans Bond and Sukuk Issuance up to IDR 5.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (ticker INKP) plans to issue bonds up to IDR 3.5 trillion and sukuk up to IDR 2 trillion. The proceeds will be used for debt repayment and working capital. The bonds and sukuk each consist of three series (tenors 370 days, 3 years, and 5 years) with coupon/profit-sharing rates of 7.25%, 10.25%, and 10.75% respectively. Both the bonds and sukuk have received a rating of idA+ and idA+(sy) from Pefindo. The public offering period is expected to run from 26 to 28 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: TBIG Plans IDR 2 Trillion Bond Issuance
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (ticker TBIG) plans to issue bonds worth IDR 2 trillion, with proceeds to be used for bond repayment and partial repayment of bank loan principal. The bonds consist of Series A worth approximately IDR 1.2 trillion (coupon 6.45% tenor 370 days) and Series B worth approximately IDR 757 billion (coupon 6.75% tenor 3 years). The bonds have received a rating of AA+(idn) from Fitch Ratings. The public offering period is expected to run from 25 to 27 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Acquires Four Oil/Chemical and LPG Vessels
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (ticker TPIA) through its subsidiary PT Chandra Daya Investasi announced that it has acquired and will operate four oil or chemical carriers and one LPG carrier. The total transaction value was not disclosed. The vessels constitute the first fleet owned by PT Chandra Daya Investasi and will be operated by its subsidiaries PT Chandra Shipping International and PT Marina Indah Maritim.

tickerNews.title: MBMA CEO Resignation Submitted
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (ticker MBMA) announced that its President Director, Devin Antonio Ridwan, submitted a resignation letter on 11 November 2024. The resignation will be discussed at an Extraordinary General Meeting whose date has not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Appoints New President Commissioner
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Aneka Tambang (ticker ANTM) on Wednesday (13/11) approved the appointment of Rauf Purnama as President Commissioner and independent commissioner, replacing F. X. Sutijastoto. Kontan reported that Rauf Purnama previously served as an expert council member in the Prabowo Subianto-Gibran Rakabuming Raka National Campaign Team for the 2024 presidential election. He also previously held the position of President Director at PT Petrokimia Gresik (1995-2001) and was a senior expert for the Ministry of Industry (2004-2009).

tickerNews.title: JTPE Announces Interim Dividend 2024

tickerNews.title: CYBR Share Sale by INV Management
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of ITSEC Asia (ticker CYBR), INV Management Pte. Ltd., sold 8 million CYBR shares at an average price of IDR 307 per share on 8 November 2024. The total transaction value was approximately IDR 2.4 billion. After this transaction, INV Management's ownership in CYBR decreased from 47.7% to 47.6%.

tickerNews.title: FORU Share Sale by IMR Asia Holding
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Fortune Indonesia (ticker FORU), IMR Asia Holding Pte. Ltd., sold 180,000 FORU shares at an average price of IDR 5,191 per share on 5 November 2024. The total transaction value was IDR 934 million. After this transaction, IMR Asia Holding's ownership in FORU decreased from 77.37% to 77.33%.
